item.title: Lowe's beats on earnings and hikes guidance, but still expects sales to fall this year
item.description: Lowe's topped quarterly earnings and revenue estimates, but even its raised sales outlook would be a decline from last year.

item.title: Walmart hikes its outlook again as shoppers spend more outside the grocery aisles
item.description: The discounter will deliver its latest sales results as inflation cools and the holiday season heats up.

item.title: Germany's Thyssenkrupp pops 10% after narrowing net loss and booking $1 billion impairment charge
item.description: Thyssenkrupp on Tuesday reported a 1-billion-euro ($1 billion) impairment on its struggling steel division.

item.title: Alibaba posts profit beat as China looks to prop up tepid consumer spend
item.description: The results come at a tricky time for Chinese commerce businesses, given the broad sluggishness in the world's second-largest economy.

item.title: Here's why investors are so excited about Disney's quarterly results
item.description: After several quarters of underperformance and investor frustration, CEO Robert Iger's turnaround plans appear to be working.
